name: Hilton Frankfurt

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Hilton Frankfurt on two occasions. On the first, we were given a terrific room called the Hoover suite, which was beautiful, very clean, had a great bathroom and a fabulous view, especially beautiful at night. The room was very spacious and we decided to have dinner in and did not regret it; it was delicious. On the second occasion, we weren't as happy because the room, instead of having a window to the exterior with a magnificent view like I was expecting, had a window to the inner foyer of the hotel, which was very strange because I always felt like it wasn't very private and we had to keep the curtains closed at all times, day or night. This was very disagreeable. But I liked the hotel so much the first time around that I'll rate it only considering the first stay. Just remember to ask for a room that faces the outside of the building.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — the window on the inner foyer

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Hilton Frankfurt 4 or 5 times on both business & leisure and have found it a great hotel. Of course, as a Hilton HHonors Diamond member I've always been upgraded to at the very least an executive floor room and at best the Presidential Suite, so I know my opinion is a bit skewed. Although, with that said, every time I've stayed all staff members, from the front desk to the executive floor lounge, are consistently friendly, helpful, and competent. The hotel is also in an excellent location and if you're there during December, it is just a short walk to the Christmas market. Overall, it is an excellent hotel and my first choice for a hotel in Frankfurt.
reviews.title: Great Hotel/Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed only for one night on a business trip, hotel is centrally located and the old city is not far, you can walk there..
reviews.title: nice comfy hotel in Frankfurt but noisy due to remodeling/refurbishing

likes.disliked: — the noise from remodeling/refurbishing..check first what is going on when booking this hotel

reviews.text: Lobby is nice with lots of glass and we had a room on the club floor so with club lounge access. The lounge is nice with drinks and snacks and the room was lovely too, except it was quite noisy from time to time because they are working on three floors a bit below the 21nd floor.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: We said when we checked out that we were woken up by the noise and the only reaction was: you should have called..as if that would bring us back to sleep??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to Frankfurt for a weekend break and to visit the christmas markets. This hotel was only about 15 mins walk from the market and about 1 min walk to the nearest underground station. The location for us could not have been much better.
reviews.title: Great hotel not far from the Christmas market

likes.liked: — It was clean and well maintained

reviews.text: The room was on the 4th floor and very nice. I like having a separate shower. You can get all the English channels on the TV which is good. The only thing it lacked, if I were to be picky, was an iron and ironing board, though I'm sure we could have got one if we'd asked.
reviews.title: Good hotel, excellent location

likes.disliked: — couldn't print a powerprint presentation on the hotel printer, didn't have the latest version

reviews.text: We didnt have breakfast here as it was expensive, and I am a fussy eater so rarely get my money's worth from a buffet..
reviews.title: If you like modern well run hotels stay here

likes.liked: — compared to london, nice, modern, full size rooms

reviews.text: The only negative I could find with this place, is the Asian bar. It was quite smoky... I'll be so pleased if/when they ban smoking in bars there, I hate to smell of smoke.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: If I were to ever go back to Frankfurt, I would have no hesitation in staying here again, or recommending it.
reviews.title: Bad Breakfast
Awfully nice place to stay
reviews.text: We had a great stay at this property. It was so new and fresh, everything in the rooms just glowed. The showers were just gorgeous, glass and marble. I even took my little kids to the restaurant, and we all had a great meal together! Overall it was just great, I can't wait to stay there again.

reviews.title: Always nice to be back . . . .
reviews.text: After a week of touring Germany and Switzerland we stayed at the Frankfurt Hilton for the last two nights to see the city before leaving. During our trip, we stayed a local hotels in other towns that cost approximately the same amount as the Frankfurt Hilton. I must say, it's always nice to get back to a Hilton.

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Hilton Frankfurt
reviews.text: For the same money we found our stay here to be the best. I remember feeling the same way a few years ago after traveling through Alaska and getting back to the Anchorage Hilton.

reviews.title: Disappointed!
reviews.text: I know chain hotels sometimes make us feel like we're missing the flavor of the city, and maybe it's me getting older, but this was my best stay of the trip. It was well decorated, the food was great, the service was excellent, I have no complaints.

reviews.title: Better than expected
reviews.text: The Hilton Frankfurt is a very nice hotel. Its location is outstanding, within walking distance to the Hauptwache and plenty of restaurants. In addition, there's a U bahn station a few hundred feet from the hotel entrance that makes getting to the airport a breeze.

Stayed at this hotel with my spouse for five days and it was great! There are no vending machines but there is an ice machine. A pants presser is in the closet, but I requested an iron and got one. I loved the huge shower, bath robe and Hilton bedroom shoes! Expect only two English speaking channels on the tv. No flat sheets on the bed, just duvets. The breakfast buffett is huge and excellent! Elevators are quick. Taxis are ready available. Non smoking rooms are available. Be sure you close your blinds at night...in June, the sun was up from 5am - 10pm! Internet is expensive, 30 euros per day. There is an internet cafe a block away called "virus" where it cost 1.50 euros for 30 minutes. A huge gym is within the hotel and is available to non-hotel guests. If you are a silver honors member, it's free...20 euros if you are only a Hilton blue honors card holder. Employees understand English. Check in/out was quick. When calling for a wake-up call, know how to tell military time. Clock radio hooks up to ipods, but the volume does not get very loud. Several shops are nearby. For a fantastic lunch/dinner, go to the high rise department store called "Galeria Kaufhof". Their 7th floor has a huge buffet and you can eat outside and enjoy the view of downtown Frankfurt.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, near everything, ice machines!

reviews.text: This hotel was very clean, modern and just steps from the main shopping and dining streets as well as adjacent to a lovely park and the cathedral.
reviews.title: Fabulous Staff, Very Kid Friendly, Large Clean Rooms

reviews.text: The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The hotel was kid friendly as we were traveling with a toddler and they provided a very nice travel crib as well! worth every penny and would highly recommend!
reviews.title: Great Location and Great Hotel Staff

reviews.text: My adult son and I stay at this hotel beginning April 25 for 3 nights. The staff is excellent. Location is the best to walk to different area. We walked to Zeil Street which is the shopping area. Along the way there other places to eat. The Zeil area is also a place where you sit and people watch. We walked to the Opera House, the Romerberg Area. the city hall Market area which seem to have a festival each day we were in Frankfurt..There is a subway about half block from the hotel. My favorite is the park behind the hotel. I coul sit and read or stroll along the path way. Hotel can arrange tours for you. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Very modern and inviting hotel - love it
best location ever for a sightseeing tour
reviews.text: The cost in euros from the airport to the hotel is between 27 and 30. Valet parking is 27 Euros. This hotel has all the extra you would need in a five star hotel.
I stayed here with a friend from the 30th of nov to the 2nd dec. We stayed here for a break away and to go to the xmas markets.
reviews.title: Check they dont take extra money from ur credit card for no reason!!

reviews.text: The rooms were average. not really what i expected, was a little disappointed, it was like a travel lodge. The bathroom was nice, with a large shower and a bath tub.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Nothing really- we didnt spend much time in the hotel during the day!

reviews.text: We had two drinks in the bar, which we're very over priced. like 25 euros for 2 drinks!!
reviews.title: Popularity Has A Price

likes.liked: — the contemporary artwork in the corridors
likes.disliked: — the hotel not honoring basic requests for a quiet no-smoking room

reviews.text: When we checked out we were asked if we wanted to pay by card or cash, and we prefered to pay cash so we got our total bill, which came to around 70 euros, as we had breakfast in bed,
reviews.title: Breathtaking rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But a few days after returning i noticed they had taken 31 euros from my account, which i was very mad about as i was assured i had paid my full bill. and i did not wish to pay anything by card as i paid all in cash. when i called they to ask why they had taken money from my account they seemed to not understand english and i ended up hanging up in frustration. and still to this day do not know why i was chared 31 euros. as i know what i had and all i had was on my bill which i paid in cash.
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.liked: — friendly staff, lovely rooms pool and health club

reviews.text: Having stayed in a number of the 5-star business hotels in Frankfurt, my favorite is the Hilton. Typically I prefer Westins and LeMeridiens to Hiltons, but in Frankfurt the Hilton has the best game in my book for these reasons:
reviews.title: My Preferred 5-Star Business Hotel in Frankfurt

reviews.text: 1. Room Size and Quality: The rooms are large, well turned out, comfortable, and pleasant. In terms of color, materials, and lighting, this hotel is at the very top end of the Hilton spectrum.
reviews.title: Great location, great room, staff missing

reviews.text: 2. Gym and Pool: The gym is a membership set-up and is vast and well-optioned. It was complimentary to me as a Gold. Machines, pool, and wet areas were excellent and a perfect option for recreation on a cold and wet winter evening.
reviews.title: Business Stay in Frankfurt

reviews.text: 3. Breakfast: Was included for me and was a standout, even among Hiltons, where breakfast is typically a strong suit.
reviews.title: First Class Service!

reviews.text: 4. Service: Checked in before noon, immediately upgraded, no waiting, helpful Executive Lounge staff, and a quick departure.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, with great views

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is very good. It is only two minutes walk to Zeil, shopping street, and 10 minutes to Romer, old town.
reviews.title: Great location and service

reviews.text: The service in the hotel is impeccible; one of the best receptions I have seen in my travels, especially, Peter.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Frankfurt

reviews.text: The interior and exterior are rather standard Hilton style, glass and metal. Rooms are pretty big by European standards.
reviews.title: The Best in Frankfurt!

reviews.text: There is an adjacent gym with a pool.
reviews.title: Perfect location, Top hotel !

reviews.text: Frankfurt is certainly not your tourist destination - there is very little to see there.
reviews.title: I've stayed here twice this month (5...

reviews.text: This place oozes class! Great place to hold meetings, at the bar area or main lobby area. Excellent service everywhere. Brilliant standard Hilton breakfast. Great service everywhere. The rooms are perfect. Basically a superb hotel.
reviews.title: Best Business Hotel

reviews.text: This is a superb hotel and a great location. It is with in walking distance to major sights and attractions.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, great location

reviews.text: The service at the hotel is excellent and all needs are catered for.
reviews.title: Great location, quiet rooms with comfortable beds, lovely pool

reviews.text: The rooms are very modern and clean and can offer some briliant views over the city.
reviews.title: Always go here for the excellent gym

reviews.text: Well worth staying here!
reviews.title: Nice, modern hotel in a good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the city the Hilton Frankfurt Hotel is a nice comfortable hotel. As such the city itself does not offer much for sight seeing apart from a few museums etc. Its best to be located in the heart of the city for easy commute to local shopping areas etc
reviews.title: A Very Cosmopolitan Hotel of choice

reviews.text: i got a chance to stay here for a day only so i could not enjoy too much on the amenities provided in here but this Hilton Frankfurt hotel is just next to Frankfurt Stock Exchange and 5 minutes' walk from the banking district. heard a lot about their Californian cuisine in Pacific Colors Restaurant and Cuban coffee in Vista Bar, but couldnt enjoy it due to crunch ot time.The hotel has lots of meeting room. i was offered a garden view room. and this had a Wireless internet access is available throughout . i am sure the hotel will come upto any ones expectation.since leaving just the other attractions, the basic amenities were just splendid.
reviews.title: It was a nice experience.
Good location and great service
reviews.text: Great location, you can walk to everything from here. Close to financial district, bourse, platz and river. Great service from bellmen to valet to front desk. Executive floor very private and quite with nice lounge. Would stay again.

I stayed here for two nights, the fifth time this year. Upon arrival in my room I found some kind of fallafel left by the previous guest in the minibar. That's a surprise! Staff removed this without cleaning the refrigirator, mind you.
reviews.title: Thing like this happen... But they shouldn't.

reviews.text: For breakfast, I ticked the box for a newspaper to be brought to my room. But it was not... I filled in the review form but did not get any respons from staff. When I mentioned this at check out the second day, the staff could only manage an embaressed smile. That's the Hilton for you!
reviews.title: best hilton in Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are decent size, clean and nicely equiped. King bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was good size with nice walk-in marble shower. Shower water pressure was a bit weak.
reviews.title: Good location for Xmas Market

reviews.text: Just come back from 3 nights at the Hilton. Thoroughly deserves its number 1 status. Great hotel, great staff, comfortable rooms. Nothing to fault. Would definately stay there again in Frankfurt
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton

reviews.text: A Great city hotel, close to uBahn and sBhan. walking distance to everything. seems to be a quiet part of town though. great breakfast restaurant out of front doors and left, it's on the corner next to the ubahn (red umberellas).
reviews.title: Great City Hotel
So-so
reviews.text: would recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were excited to stay, given the favorable reviews. Unfortunately, the hotel is little more than a 3 star business hotel. No charm, aesthetics or concierge, for that matter. Amazingly, the staff could not recommend a breakfast restaurant. Our own search--a five minute walk--revealed 3 fine restaurants within one block. This may have to do with the fact that the staff seemed listless and unhappy.
reviews.title: Deserves its accolades!
Impeccable Service
reviews.text: To compound matters, the hotel charges exorbitant rates for internet, even in its business center or for its guests such as me that have achieved higher status due to their utilization of Hilton. I am a Diamond with Hilton, and have never experienced this. We found a small internet cafe a block away--next to one of the restaurants the staff was unaware of--that charged 1 euro as compaired to the 12 euros the hotel was requesting.

description: Secluded within a large park, the modern Hilton Frankfurt is an oasis of calm and relaxation in the vibrant city centre. Frankfurt attractions and shopping locations are on your doorstep. Spacious rooms and suites feature fresh colours and panoramic windows offering views over the city or the park. Take your time to unwind at the Californian restaurant and recharge your body and mind in the Health & Fitness Club with 25 m pool overlooking the park.
